  • A.65
  • B.15
  • C.45
  • D.20
Correct Answer: 15

Urdu = Only Hindi = 5

U + 5 + 20 = 40

Or U = 15.

Question 28
The fallacy where the conclusion does not logically follow from the premises is called:
  • A.Adhominem
  • B.Straw man
  • C.Non-sequitur
  • D.Red herring
Correct Answer: Non-sequitur

A non-sequitur fallacy occurs when the conclusion does not logically follow from the given premises.

Question 29
Arrange the four noble truths of Buddhism in the chronological order:A. NirodhaB. Marga/MaggaC.DukhaD. SamudayaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, A, C, D
  • B.C, D, A, B
  • C.D, C, B, A
  • D.A, C, B, D
Correct Answer: C, D, A, B

The Four Noble Truths of Buddhism in correct order are:

Dukkha – Truth of suffering

Samudaya – Cause of suffering

Nirodha – Cessation of suffering

Magga/Marga – Path leading to cessation

 

Matching with the given list:

C → D → A → B.

Question 30
Which of the following are valid deductive forms of reasoning?A. Modus PonensB. Modus TollensC. Hypothetical syllogismD. Argument from analogyChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.A, B and D Only
  • D.C and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only

Valid deductive reasoning forms are:

  • Modus Ponens → valid deductive
  • Modus Tollens → valid deductive
  • Hypothetical syllogism → valid deductive
  • Argument from analogy → not deductive (it is inductive)

 

So, the valid deductive forms are A, B, and C.

Question 31
Match List–I with List–IIList–IA.AdhominemB. Straw manC. False causeD. Red herringList–III. Mistaking correlation for causationII. Attacking the person instead of issueIII. Misrepresenting someone’s argumentIV. Diverting attention to another issueChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–IV, B–II, C–I, D–III
  • B.A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV
  • C.A–II, B–I, C–III, D–IV
  • D.A–III, B–II, C–I, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV

A. Ad hominem → attacking the person, not the argument → II

B. Straw man → misrepresenting someone’s argument → III

C. False cause → mistaking correlation for causation → I

D. Red herring → diverting attention to another issue → IV

 

Correct matching:

A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV.

Question 32
According to Bloom’s CAP Classification of Educational Objectives, ________ is an example of Psychomotor Domain.
  • A.Organizing
  • B.Application
  • C.Manipulation
  • D.Comprehension
Correct Answer: Manipulation

In Bloom’s classification (CAP Model):

C → Cognitive

A → Affective

P → Psychomotor

 

Psychomotor domain involves physical skills, motor actions, and coordination.

(A) Organizing → Affective

(B) Application → Cognitive

(C) Manipulation → Psychomotor

(D) Comprehension → Cognitive

Question 33
‘Verbal Association Learning’ was proposed by:
  • A.Melton
  • B.Thorndike
  • C.Cronbach
  • D.Gagné
Correct Answer: Gagné

Robert Gagné proposed Verbal Association Learning as one of the eight types of learning in his hierarchy of learning. It involves forming links between verbal units (like paired-associate learning).

Question 34
Arrange the important events according to Erikson’s Eight Stages of Psychosocial Development sequentially:A. Toilet trainingB. FeedingC. Reflections and acceptance on one’s lifeD. Love relationE. Peer relationshipsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, C, B, D, E
  • B.C, A, B, D, E
  • C.B, A, E, D, C
  • D.A, D, E, C, B
Correct Answer: B, A, E, D, C

Erikson’s stages in sequence (with key events):

  • Feeding → Trust vs Mistrust (infancy)
  • Toilet training → Autonomy vs Shame (toddlerhood)
  • Peer relationships → Industry vs Inferiority (school age)
  • Love relations → Intimacy vs Isolation (young adulthood)
  • Reflection on one’s life → Integrity vs Despair (old age)

 

So, the correct sequence is:

B → A → E → D → C.

Question 35
Some statements are given below. Mark the ‘Right’ combination:A. Teaching is included in learning – TrueB. Post active stage of teaching provides a corrective and remedial scope of teaching – FalseC. Teaching is included in learning – FalseD. Post active stage of teaching provides a corrective and remedial scope of teaching – TrueChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and D Only
  • B.C and B Only
  • C.A and B Only
  • D.C and D Only
Correct Answer: A and D Only

A. Teaching is included in learning – True

Correct — learning is a broader process, and teaching is one of its means. So A is True.

 

B. Post-active stage of teaching provides a corrective and remedial scope of teaching – False

Incorrect — the post-active stage (evaluation stage) does provide corrective and remedial feedback. So B is False.

 

C. Teaching is included in learning – False

Wrong — as explained, teaching is included in learning. So C is False.

 

D. Post-active stage of teaching provides a corrective and remedial scope of teaching – True

Correct — this is exactly the function of the post-active stage. So D is True.

Question 36
Match List–I with List–IIList–I(Mental approaches)A. RecallB. DiscriminationC. Hypothesis establishmentD. EvaluationList–II(Objectives related with)I. UnderstandingII. KnowledgeIII. CreativityIV. ApplicationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–II, B–IV, C–I, D–III
  • B.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
  • C.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
  • D.A–IV, B–II, C–I, D–III
Correct Answer: A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III

A. Recall → Knowledge (II)

Recalling facts is directly part of the knowledge objective.

 

B. Discrimination → Understanding (I)

To discriminate differences/similarities, a learner must understand the concepts.

 

C. Hypothesis establishment → Application (IV)

According to Bloom-based NET keys, forming a hypothesis is treated under Application, because the learner applies known principles to create a tentative explanation.

 

D. Evaluation → Creativity (III)

Evaluation requires judgment, reasoning, and higher-order thinking — mapped here to Creativity (the highest level available in given options).

 

Correct option: (B) A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III.

Question 37
PSTN stands for:
  • A.Public Service for Technical Networks
  • B.Public Switched Telephone Network
  • C.Public Satellite Television Network
  • D.Public Safety Trademark Network
Correct Answer: Public Switched Telephone Network

PSTN refers to the traditional circuit-switched telephone system used worldwide for voice communication.

Question 38
The decimal number equivalent to binary digit 110 is ________.
  • A.4
  • B.5
  • C.6
  • D.7
Correct Answer: 6

Binary 110 converted to decimal = 1 × 22 + 1 × 21 + 0 × 20 = 6.

Question 39
Choose the ‘RIGHT’ statements:A. CISCO is a Hockey manufacturerB. VLC is Visible Light CommunicationC. SDN is System of Digital NetworkD.HyperCatis an Open JSON basedCatalogformatE. SoC is Sequence of ChoiceChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.B and C Only
  • C.C and E Only
  • D.B and D Only
Correct Answer: B and D Only

A. CISCO is a Hockey manufacturer

False — Cisco is a networking and IT company, not a hockey brand.

 

B. VLC is Visible Light Communication

True — VLC stands for Visible Light Communication, a wireless communication technology.

 

C. SDN is System of Digital Network

False — SDN stands for Software Defined Networking.

 

D. HyperCat is an Open JSON-based Catalog format

True — HyperCat is indeed an open JSON-based IoT catalog format.

 

E. SoC is Sequence of Choice

False — SoC stands for System on Chip.

Question 40
Match List–I with List–IIList–I(Type of Processor)A. CISC ProcessorsB. RISC ProcessorsC. EPIC ProcessorsD. Multicore ProcessorsList–II(Characteristics)I. Operating system controls overall assignment of tasksII. Use explicit parallelismIII. These possess so many processing features, making the job of machine language programmers easierIV. Have a small instruction setChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–II, D–I
  • C.A–II, B–IV, C–I, D–III
  • D.A–III, B–II, C–IV, D–I
Correct Answer: A–III, B–IV, C–II, D–I

CISC processors are known for having many complex instructions. This makes programming easier for machine-language programmers. So CISC matches with the characteristic that says they possess many processing features that simplify programming.

 

RISC processors are designed with a small instruction set, focusing on simplicity and faster execution. So RISC matches with the statement that mentions a small instruction set.

 

EPIC processors (Explicitly Parallel Instruction Computing) work by using explicit parallelism, where the compiler determines which operations can run simultaneously. So EPIC matches with the characteristic about explicit parallelism.

 

Multicore processors include multiple cores that work together. The operating system plays a major role in managing and assigning tasks across these cores. So multicore processors match with the characteristic about task assignment by the operating system.

 

Putting all matches together, the correct pair is:

A – III, B – IV, C – II, D – I.

Question 41
As per Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Act (2000), the permissible noise level (Leq) during the day for silence zones is:
  • A.55 dB(A)
  • B.50 dB(A)
  • C.45 dB(A)
  • D.65 dB(A)
Correct Answer: 50 dB(A)

Under the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000, the permissible noise limits are clearly defined.

 

For Silence Zones, the allowed noise level is:

  • 50 dB(A) during the day
  • 40 dB(A) during the night

 

Therefore, the correct day-time limit for silence zones is:

Question 42
Which of the following pertains to Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) under Kyoto Protocol?
  • A.Getting Certified Emission Reductions (CER) credits for industrialised countries
  • B.Reducing noise pollution
  • C.Decreasing amount ofchlorofluorocarbons
  • D.Maintaining ozone layer
Correct Answer: Getting Certified Emission Reductions (CER) credits for industrialised countries

The Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) is a provision under the Kyoto Protocol that allows industrialised (Annex I) countries to earn Certified Emission Reduction (CER) credits by investing in emission-reduction projects in developing countries.

 

These CER credits help them meet their emission-reduction targets.

It is not related to noise pollution, CFCs, or ozone layer protection.

Correct answer: (A) Getting Certified Emission Reductions (CER) credits for industrialised countries.

Question 43
Arrange the phases of modern approach to disaster management in order (from initial to final):A. RecoveryB. PreparednessC. ResponseD. MitigationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.C, B, A, D
  • B.D, B, C, A
  • C.A, B, C, D
  • D.B, C, A, D
Correct Answer: D, B, C, A

The modern disaster management cycle follows this sequence:

  • Mitigation – steps taken to reduce the impact of future disasters
  • Preparedness – planning and training before a disaster
  • Response – action taken during and immediately after a disaster
  • Recovery – restoring normalcy after the disaster

 

So the correct order is:

D → B → C → A.

Question 44
Choose the correct statements regarding environmental incidents from the following:A. Bhopal accident was due to methyl isocyanateB. Hiroshima and Nagasaki incident was due to radioactivityC. Bhuj incident occurred due to poison gasD. Fukushima nuclear power plant incident was due to earthquakeE. Chernobyl accident in Soviet Union occurred due to volcanoChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.A, B and D Only
  • C.A, C and E Only
  • D.C, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

A. Bhopal accident was due to methyl isocyanate

This is correct. The 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy was caused by a leak of methyl isocyanate (MIC).

 

B. Hiroshima and Nagasaki incident was due to radioactivity

Correct. The atomic bombings released massive radioactive fallout.

 

C. Bhuj incident occurred due to poison gas

Incorrect. The Bhuj disaster (2001) was due to a major earthquake, not gas.

 

D. Fukushima nuclear power plant incident was due to earthquake

Correct. The 2011 Fukushima disaster was triggered by a massive earthquake followed by a tsunami.

 

E. Chernobyl accident occurred due to volcano

Incorrect. It occurred due to a nuclear reactor explosion, not a volcano.

Question 45
Match List–I with List–IIList–I(Waste Disposal Method)A. Modern LandfillingB. Open land dumpingC. IncinerationD. Bioconversion into compostList–II(Characteristics)I. Reduced waste volumeII.Well engineeredand managed facilityIII. Ecofriendly processIV. Low cost of dumpingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I
  • B.A–III, B–II, C–I, D–IV
  • C.A–II, B–IV, C–I, D–III
  • D.A–II, B–I, C–III, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–II, B–IV, C–I, D–III

A. Modern Landfilling → Well-engineered and managed facility

Modern sanitary landfills are scientifically designed and engineered. So A → II

 

B. Open land dumping → Low cost of dumping

Open dumping requires no engineering or treatment, so it is very cheap. So B → IV

 

C. Incineration → Reduced waste volume

Incineration burns waste and drastically reduces its volume (by 80–90%). So C → I

 

D. Bioconversion into compost → Eco-friendly process

Composting converts biodegradable waste into useful manure. So D → III.

Question 46
Passage:The first step is for us to realise that a city need not be a frustrater of life; it can be among other things, a mechanism for enhancing life, for producing possibilities of living which are not to be realized except through cities. But, for that to happen, deliberate and drastic planning is needed. Towns as much as animals, must have their systems of organs—those for transport and circulation are an obvious example.What we need now are organ systems for recreation, leisure, culture, community expression. This means abundance of open space, easy access to unspoilt nature, beauty in parks and in fine buildings, gymnasia and swimming baths and recreation grounds in plenty, central spaces for celebrations and demonstrations, halls for citizens’ meetings, concert halls and theatres and cinemas that belong to the city.And the buildings must not be built anyhow or dumped down anywhere; both they and their grouping should mean something important to the people of the place.Cities can be made more worth-living if they:
  • A.are vigorously planned to serve the needs of the people
  • B.have only good transportation facility
  • C.have many hospitals
  • D.have only more cinemas and sources of entertainment
Correct Answer: are vigorously planned to serve the needs of the people

According to the passage, a city becomes worth living when it is deliberately and drastically planned, with proper systems for recreation, culture, open spaces, community facilities, beauty, and meaningful building design. The emphasis is on comprehensive planning that enhances the quality of life.

 

Options B, C, and D mention only single facilities, whereas the passage clearly highlights the need for holistic, thoughtful planning.

Question 47
Passage:The first step is for us to realise that a city need not be a frustrater of life; it can be among other things, a mechanism for enhancing life, for producing possibilities of living which are not to be realized except through cities. But, for that to happen, deliberate and drastic planning is needed. Towns as much as animals, must have their systems of organs—those for transport and circulation are an obvious example.What we need now are organ systems for recreation, leisure, culture, community expression. This means abundance of open space, easy access to unspoilt nature, beauty in parks and in fine buildings, gymnasia and swimming baths and recreation grounds in plenty, central spaces for celebrations and demonstrations, halls for citizens’ meetings, concert halls and theatres and cinemas that belong to the city.And the buildings must not be built anyhow or dumped down anywhere; both they and their grouping should mean something important to the people of the place.What could be the most suitable title for the passage?
  • A.Towns versus Animals
  • B.The need for planned cities
  • C.Moderncities :Benefits and Shortcomings
  • D.How to develop a Global city
Correct Answer: The need for planned cities

The entire passage stresses that cities can enhance life only when they are deliberately and drastically planned. It highlights the need for open spaces, cultural facilities, recreational systems, meaningful building design, and community areas — all pointing toward proper city planning.

 

The other options do not capture the central theme as accuratel.

Question 48
Passage:The first step is for us to realise that a city need not be a frustrater of life; it can be among other things, a mechanism for enhancing life, for producing possibilities of living which are not to be realized except through cities. But, for that to happen, deliberate and drastic planning is needed. Towns as much as animals, must have their systems of organs—those for transport and circulation are an obvious example.What we need now are organ systems for recreation, leisure, culture, community expression. This means abundance of open space, easy access to unspoilt nature, beauty in parks and in fine buildings, gymnasia and swimming baths and recreation grounds in plenty, central spaces for celebrations and demonstrations, halls for citizens’ meetings, concert halls and theatres and cinemas that belong to the city.And the buildings must not be built anyhow or dumped down anywhere; both they and their grouping should mean something important to the people of the place.The word ‘drastic’ in the passage means:
  • A.Radical
  • B.Orderly
  • C.Consistent
  • D.Determined
Correct Answer: Radical

In the passage, “drastic planning” refers to strong, significant, and radical changes needed to improve cities — not just orderly or consistent adjustments.

Question 49
Passage:The first step is for us to realise that a city need not be a frustrater of life; it can be among other things, a mechanism for enhancing life, for producing possibilities of living which are not to be realized except through cities. But, for that to happen, deliberate and drastic planning is needed. Towns as much as animals, must have their systems of organs—those for transport and circulation are an obvious example.What we need now are organ systems for recreation, leisure, culture, community expression. This means abundance of open space, easy access to unspoilt nature, beauty in parks and in fine buildings, gymnasia and swimming baths and recreation grounds in plenty, central spaces for celebrations and demonstrations, halls for citizens’ meetings, concert halls and theatres and cinemas that belong to the city.And the buildings must not be built anyhow or dumped down anywhere; both they and their grouping should mean something important to the people of the place.The phrase ‘Unspoilt Nature’ is in the context of __________.
  • A.Nature is not allowed to be a stumbling block in the human’s progress
  • B.Building cities with the system of organs like those of animals
  • C.Free access to parks and open spaces
  • D.Nature to retain its primitive condition
Correct Answer: Building cities with the system of organs like those of animals

The passage talks about providing citizens with abundance of open space, easy access to unspoilt nature, beauty in parks, etc. Here, unspoilt nature means nature that is still in its original, undisturbed, natural state.

Question 50
Passage:The first step is for us to realise that a city need not be a frustrater of life; it can be among other things, a mechanism for enhancing life, for producing possibilities of living which are not to be realized except through cities. But, for that to happen, deliberate and drastic planning is needed. Towns as much as animals, must have their systems of organs—those for transport and circulation are an obvious example.What we need now are organ systems for recreation, leisure, culture, community expression. This means abundance of open space, easy access to unspoilt nature, beauty in parks and in fine buildings, gymnasia and swimming baths and recreation grounds in plenty, central spaces for celebrations and demonstrations, halls for citizens’ meetings, concert halls and theatres and cinemas that belong to the city.And the buildings must not be built anyhow or dumped down anywhere; both they and their grouping should mean something important to the people of the place.The antonym of the word ‘frustrater’ used in the passage is __________.
  • A.Promoter
  • B.Approver
  • C.Admirer
  • D.Downer
Correct Answer: Promoter

A “frustrater” is someone or something that blocks or hinders progress. A promoter is someone who supports or encourages progress, which is the opposite meaning.

Quiz Attempt #119704

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table represents the percentage expenditure of the annual income of six persons A-F on six different items, namely, Food, Rent, Transport, Clothes, Entertainment and Miscellaneous. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the annual incomes of B and C are Rs. 432000 and Rs. 528000, respectively, then what is the difference between the amount spent by them on Transport ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rs. 18496
  • B.Rs. 18828
  • C.Rs. 19216
  • D.Rs. 19488
Correct Answer: Rs. 19488

Required Diff = 22.6 % of 432000 – 14.8% of 528000 

= 97632 – 78144

= 19488

Question 2
The following table represents the percentage expenditure of the annual income of six persons A-F on six different items, namely, Food, Rent, Transport, Clothes, Entertainment and Miscellaneous. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the amount of money spent on food by C and D is Rs. 144000 and Rs. 172800, respectively, then the annual income of C is _____ % of the annual income of D.(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.47.5
  • B.60
  • C.62.5
  • D.120
Correct Answer: 62.5

Annual income of C = 1440000.24 = 600000

Annual income of D = 1728000.18 = 960000

Required Percentage = 600000960000×100 = 62.5%

Question 3
The following table represents the percentage expenditure of the annual income of six persons A-F on six different items, namely, Food, Rent, Transport, Clothes, Entertainment and Miscellaneous. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the annual income of each of C and D is Rs. 840000, then what is the sum of the amount spent by C on Rent and that by D on Miscellaneous items?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rs. 288820
  • B.Rs. 290520
  • C.Rs. 293160
  • D.Rs. 295700
Correct Answer: Rs. 293160

Required amount = (16.3 + 18.6)% of 840000 = 293160

Question 4
The following table represents the percentage expenditure of the annual income of six persons A-F on six different items, namely, Food, Rent, Transport, Clothes, Entertainment and Miscellaneous. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the monthly income of A and D are Rs. 80000 and Rs. 72000, respectively, then the amount of money spent by A on Rent is _____ % more than the amount spent by D on clothes.(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.32.62
  • B.38.89
  • C.36.54
  • D.34.24
Correct Answer: 38.89

Required Percentage = 15% of 80000-12% of 7200012% of 72000 × 100

Question 5
The following table represents the percentage expenditure of the annual income of six persons A-F on six different items, namely, Food, Rent, Transport, Clothes, Entertainment and Miscellaneous. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the annual income of each of the six persons is Rs. 3 lakh, then the amount of money spent on clothes is more than Rs. 41800 by exactly _____ persons.(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.2
  • B.3
  • C.4
  • D.5
Correct Answer: 2

Amount is greater than 41800 only for B and E i.e. 2 persons.

Question 6
A relationship in which a less-experienced learner acquires knowledge and skills under the guidance of an expert is known as :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Cloud computing
  • B.Cognitive load
  • C.Cognitive apprenticeship
  • D.Collective monologue
Correct Answer: Cognitive apprenticeship

Cognitive apprenticeship refers to a learning relationship where a novice (learner) gains knowledge and skills under the guidance of an expert, similar to traditional apprenticeship but focused on cognitive and thinking processes (e.g., problem-solving, reasoning).

 

It involves techniques like modelling, coaching, scaffolding, articulation, reflection, and exploration.

 

Thus, correct answer is option (C).

Question 7
The contents of swayamprabha channel - 15 with the theme of ‘Capacity Building and Teacher Education’ is provided by :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.CEC, New Delhi
  • B.IIT Delhi
  • C.IGNOU, New Delhi
  • D.IIT Kanpur
Correct Answer: IGNOU, New Delhi

The contents of swayamprabha channel - 15 with the theme of ‘Capacity Building and Teacher Education’ is provided by IGNOU, New Delhi.

Question 8
Which of the following are the sub-types of long term memory ?(a) Episodic memory(b) Semantic memory(c) Procedural memory(d) Priming(e) Class conditioning effectsChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)
  • B.(b), (d) and (e) Only
  • C.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • D.(c), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)

Long-term memory is broadly divided into explicit (declarative) and implicit (non-declarative) memory, and all the options listed are recognized sub-types of long-term memory.

 

1. Episodic memory –

A type of explicit memory

 

Stores personal experiences or events (e.g., your last birthday party)

 

2. Semantic memory –

Also a type of explicit memory

 

Deals with general knowledge and facts (e.g., capital of India)

 

3. Procedural memory –

A type of implicit memory

 

Involves skills and habits (e.g., riding a bicycle)

 

4. Priming –

A type of implicit memory

 

Prior exposure to a stimulus influences response to a later stimulus

 

5. Classical conditioning effects –

Another type of implicit memory

 

Involves learned associations between stimuli (e.g., Pavlov's dog experiment)

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 9
A marketing instructor wants to engage students by conducting live polls during an online lecture to gather instant feedback on marketing strategies. Which of the following tools should the instructor use for creating and displaying polls ?(a) Adobe Illustrator(b) Slido(c) Straw Poll(d) Camtasia(e) FlipgridChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b) and (e) Only
  • B.(a) and (d) Only
  • C.(b) and (c) Only
  • D.(c), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (b) and (c) Only

The question asks for tools that allow creating and displaying live polls with instant feedback during an online lecture.

 

Suitable Tools:

(b) Slido – Yes

 

A popular live polling and Q&A tool integrated with platforms like Zoom, Webex, and MS Teams. Ideal for gathering real-time feedback.

 

(c) Straw Poll – Yes

 

A simple and quick tool to create polls and get immediate results.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 10
An English teacher asks students to create a multimedia presentation analysing a novel's themes, characters, and literacy devices. Which assessment method is most suitable to check the real time progress of students ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Authentic Assessment
  • B.Summative Assessment
  • C.Norm-referenced Assessment
  • D.Ipsative Assessment
Correct Answer: Authentic Assessment

Authentic Assessment involves tasks that reflect real-world challenges and require students to apply their knowledge in practical, meaningful ways.

 

In this case, asking students to create a multimedia presentation analyzing a novel is a task that:

  • Engages creativity,
  • Applies literary analysis,
  • Reflects real-world communication skills (e.g., presentations, digital tools).

 

It also allows the teacher to monitor real-time progress as students plan, build, and present their work.

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 11
Identify the main preoccupations of qualitative researchers.(a) Emphasis on process(b) Emphasis on generalization(c) Emphasis on context(d) Emphasis on descriptionChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(a), (b) and (d) Only
  • D.(a), (c) and (d) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (d) Only

Qualitative researchers focus on understanding and describing complex phenomena in their natural context. Their main preoccupations typically include:

Emphasis on process (a) – understanding how things unfold over time.

Emphasis on context (c) – considering the surrounding context to better understand the situation.

Emphasis on description (d) – providing detailed, rich descriptions of experiences or events.

Generalization (b) is more of a focus in quantitative research, which aims to apply findings to broader populations.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) (a), (c), and (d) Only.

Question 12
Two researchers obtain similar results while investigating a problem following different methodologies. Their measurements show :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Interrater validity
  • B.Convergent validity
  • C.Construct validity
  • D.Test-Retest validity
Correct Answer: Convergent validity

When two researchers obtain similar results while investigating the same problem using different methodologies, this is referred to as convergent validity. Convergent validity is the degree to which two measures that are supposed to be measuring the same concept show similar results, even when different methods or instruments are used.

Interrater validity (A) involves the agreement between different raters or observers.

Construct validity (C) refers to how well a test measures the concept it's intended to measure.

Test-Retest validity (D) refers to the consistency of a measurement over time.

Thus, the correct answer is (B) Convergent validity.

Question 13
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Abbreviations)(a) ante.,(b) cf.(c) et.al.,(d) passim:List - II (Meaning)(i) here and there(ii) and others(iii) compare(iv) beforeChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)

Here’s the correct match between the abbreviations and their meanings:

(a) ante. means before (iv).

(b) cf. means compare (iii).

(c) et.al. means and others (ii).

(d) passim means here and there (i).

Thus, the correct answer is (A) (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i).

Question 14
Identify the non-probability sampling techniques :(a) Systematic sampling(b) Simple random sampling(c) Snowball sampling(d) Purposive samplingChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(c) and (d) Only
  • C.(a), (c) and (d) Only
  • D.(a), (b) and (c) Only
Correct Answer: (c) and (d) Only

Non-probability sampling techniques are those where the probability of each participant being selected is not known. These methods do not rely on random selection, and the researcher has more control over who is selected.

Systematic sampling (a) and simple random sampling (b) are both probability sampling techniques because they involve random selection.

Snowball sampling (c) and purposive sampling (d) are non-probability sampling techniques because they involve selecting participants based on specific criteria or referrals, rather than random selection.

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) (c) and (d) Only.

Question 15
Identify the parametric tests used for statistical analysis.(a) t-test(b) H-test(c) F-test(d) U-testChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(b) and (c) Only
  • C.(c) and (d) Only
  • D.(a) and (c) Only
Correct Answer: (a) and (c) Only

Parametric tests are statistical tests that assume the data follows a certain distribution (usually a normal distribution) and require specific conditions such as homogeneity of variance.

t-test (a) and F-test (c) are both parametric tests. The t-test is used to compare means, and the F-test is used in analysis of variance (ANOVA) to compare variances across multiple groups.

H-test (b) and U-test (d) are non-parametric tests, which do not rely on specific distribution assumptions.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) (a) and (c) Only.

Question 16
The etic approach to communication is _____ in character.(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Restrictive
  • B.Mechanical
  • C.Universal
  • D.Non-cultural
Correct Answer: Universal

The etic approach in communication and anthropology refers to the study of communication from an outsider’s perspective, using universal categories and concepts that are not specific to any one culture.

 

It contrasts with the emic approach, which focuses on understanding communication from within a specific cultural context.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 17
Ferdinand de Saussure's approach to the study of signs is described as :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Semiology
  • B.Semantics
  • C.Signification
  • D.Signifying system
Correct Answer: Semiology

Ferdinand de Saussure, a Swiss linguist, is known as the father of modern linguistics and a pioneer in the field of semiology.

 

He defined semiology as the science of signs — a discipline that studies how signs (like words, images, gestures) function in society to convey meaning.

 

According to Saussure, a sign consists of two parts:

  • Signifier (the form of the word or image)
  • Signified (the concept it represents).

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 18
According to Marshal McLuhan, examples of high definition media are :(a) Speech(b) Photograph(c) Radio(d) Cinema(e) CartoonChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e) Only
  • D.(a), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (b), (c) and (d) Only

According to Marshall McLuhan, media are categorized as high-definition or low-definition based on how much information they provide and how much participation they require from the audience.

 

High-definition media:

These media are rich in detail and data, requiring low audience participation because they fill in most of the sensory information.

 

(b) Photograph – Highly detailed visual medium

 

(c) Radio – Rich in sound; requires less imaginative effort

 

(d) Cinema – Combines visuals and sound with high detail

 

Low-definition media: Require more audience involvement to fill in gaps.

 

(a) Speech – Less sensory detail; more interpretation needed

 

(e) Cartoon – Simplified visuals; high audience participation

Question 19
Find out the correct chronological order of the following :(a) First binary computer by Britishers(b) Printing press(c) Plan for mechanical computer(d) Single-screen motion picture exhibition(e) First public broadcast of televisionChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (c), (e), (d), (b)
  • B.(b), (c), (d), (e), (a)
  • C.(c), (e), (a), (b), (d)
  • D.(d), (a), (b), (c), (e)
Correct Answer: (b), (c), (d), (e), (a)

Chronological Order with Approximate Dates:

(b) Printing press – c. 1440

 

Invented by Johannes Gutenberg, revolutionizing the spread of information.

 

(c) Plan for mechanical computer – 1830s

 

Charles Babbage proposed the Analytical Engine, considered the first concept of a mechanical computer.

 

(d) Single-screen motion picture exhibition – 1895

 

The Lumière brothers conducted the first public film screening.

 

(e) First public broadcast of television – 1930s

 

The BBC began regular public television broadcasts in 1936.

 

(a) First binary computer by Britishers – 1943–44

 

The Colossus computer, developed by British codebreakers during World War II, is considered the first binary programmable computer.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 20
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Authors)(a) Roland Barthes(b) Pierre Bourdieu(c) Antonio Gramsci(d) Jean BaudrillardList - II (Concepts)(i) Doxa(ii) Hegemony(ii) Simulation(iv) MythChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)

  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)

The correct match is as follows:

Question 21
A sum of money is equally divided among a number of children. Had there been 10 children less, each would have received Rs. 5 more, and had there been 10 children more each would have received Rs. 3 less. What is the sum of money that is distributed ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.300
  • B.600
  • C.750
  • D.900
Correct Answer: 600

Let there are N children and Average is A and S be the sum of money.

Then, SN = A --- (i)

SN-10 = A + 5 ---------(ii)

and SN+10 =A-3 ----------(iii)

Solving these equations, we get

 

N = 40, A = 15

S = 40 × 15 = 600

Question 22
Find out the wrong term from the given series :125, 126, 124, 127, 123, 129(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.126
  • B.124
  • C.123
  • D.129
Correct Answer: 129

Alternate terms increase by 1.

Instead of 129, it should be 128.

Question 23
If the selling price of Rs. 276 results in a discount of 8% on the marked price of an item, at what price should the item be sold to offer a discount of 13% ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rs. 265
  • B.Rs. 251
  • C.Rs. 257
  • D.Rs. 261
Correct Answer: Rs. 261

MP = 2760.92 = 300

SP with 13% discount = 300 × 0.87 = 261

Question 24
In a certain coding language, the word 'TRAIN' is coded as ‘VPCGP’, then the word 'PROUD' will be coded as :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.QSPVE
  • B.RPQSF
  • C.RQPTF
  • D.RQQSE
Correct Answer: RPQSF

P + 1 = R

R – 1 = P

O + 1 = Q

U – 1 = S

D + 1 = F

Thus, code will be RPQSF,

Question 25
7 pumps, working 10 hours a day, can empty a tank in 20 days. How many hours a day must 5 pumps operate to empty the tank in 14 days ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.20 hours
  • B.18 hours
  • C.16 hours
  • D.14 hours
Correct Answer: 20 hours

7 × 10 × 20 = 5 × x × 14

or x = 20 hours

Question 26
Which fallacy is committed in the following argument-"Ambassador cars have almost disappeared. This is an ambassador car. Therefore, this car has almost disappeared" :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Equivocation
  • B.Fallacy of Division
  • C.Hasty Generalization
  • D.Slippery Slope
Correct Answer: Fallacy of Division

The fallacy committed in the argument "Ambassador cars have almost disappeared. This is an ambassador car. Therefore, this car has almost disappeared" is Fallacy of Division (B).

The Fallacy of Division occurs when it is assumed that what is true of the whole must be true for the parts. In this case, the argument assumes that because Ambassador cars as a category have almost disappeared, any individual Ambassador car must also have almost disappeared. This reasoning incorrectly applies a property of the whole (Ambassador cars) to a specific instance (this particular car).

Question 27
Which of the following statements are true regarding contrary propositions ?(a) They cannot both be true(b) They cannot both be false(c) They can both be false(d) If one is true the other must be falseChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(b) and (c) Only
  • B.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • C.(a), (c) and (d) Only
  • D.(d) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (d) Only

In the Classical Square of Opposition, contrary propositions are those that cannot both be true at the same time, but they can both be false.

Here’s the breakdown of the statements:

(a) They cannot both be true: This is correct. Contrary propositions cannot both be true at the same time.

(b) They cannot both be false: This is incorrect. Contrary propositions can both be false, as long as they are not both true.

(c) They can both be false: This is correct. Contrary propositions can both be false.

(d) If one is true, the other must be false: This is also correct. If one contrary proposition is true, the other must be false.

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) (a), (c) and (d) Only.

Question 28
Which of the following statements are logically equivalent ?(a) Some non-dogs are non-friendly animals(b) Some dogs are friendly animals(c) Some friendly animals are dogs(d) All dogs are friendly animalsChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(b) and (c) Only
  • B.(b) and (d) Only
  • C.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • D.(a) and (d) Only
Correct Answer: (b) and (c) Only

. “Some dogs are friendly animals” and “Some friendly animals are dogs” are CONVERSION of each other.

Question 29
Which of the following are arranged in the order of increasing connotation ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Vertebrates, mammals, canine, labradors
  • B.Mammals, vertebrates, canine, labradors
  • C.Canine, labradors, mammals, vertebrates
  • D.Labradors, canine, mammals, vertebrates
Correct Answer: Vertebrates, mammals, canine, labradors

Connotation refers to the additional meanings or associations a term carries beyond its direct definition. When considering increasing connotation, we start with the most general term and move toward the more specific or detailed term.

Let's break down the terms in each option:

Vertebrates: A very general category, including all animals with backbones.

Mammals: A more specific category within vertebrates, focusing on animals that are warm-blooded, have hair, and typically give live birth.

Canine: Even more specific, referring to dogs and dog-like animals.

Labradors: The most specific, referring to a specific breed of dog within the canine category.

So, the order of increasing connotation (from the most general to the most specific) should be:

Vertebrates → Mammals → Canine → Labradors.

Thus, the correct answer is (A) Vertebrates, mammals, canine, labradors.

Question 30
Which of the following arguments is fallacious because of the middle term being too narrow ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.All things are non-eternal because they are knowable
  • B.Sound is eternal, because it is audible
  • C.File is cold because it is substance
  • D.Wherever there is fire, there is smoke
Correct Answer: Sound is eternal, because it is audible

It is a characteristic of "Asadharana" fallacy.

 

Asadharana: Here the middle term is too narrow. It is present only in the paksa and neither in the sapaksa nor in the vipaksa. It violates the rule that the middle term should be present in the sapaksa (sapaksasattva); e.g., ‘sound is eternal, because it is audible'. Here audibility belongs to sound only and is present nowhere else.

Question 31
Mobile games were the first to popularize ________ which uses an image of an actual place orthing and adds digital information to it.(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Virtual Reality
  • B.Augmented Reality
  • C.Mixed Reality
  • D.Computer-Aided Design (CAD)
Correct Answer: Augmented Reality

The correct answer is option (B) - Augmented Reality.

 

Augmented Reality (AR) is a technology that overlays digital content (like images, sounds, or data) onto the real world through devices such as smartphones or AR glasses. Mobile games like Pokémon GO were among the first to popularize AR by blending virtual characters with real-world locations using the phone's camera.

Question 32
An Internet standard that allows for adding media attachments to an email is called :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.MIME
  • B.DHCP
  • C.HDMI
  • D.FTP
Correct Answer: MIME

The correct answer is: (A) MIME

 

MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) is an Internet standard that extends the format of email to support:

 

Text in character sets other than ASCII,

 

Attachments such as images, audio, video, PDFs, and application programs.

 

It allows emails to include multimedia content beyond just plain text.

Question 33
Match List – I with List – 11.List – I (Malware)(a) Ransomware(b) Spyware(c) Worm(d) Trojan HorsesList – II (Definition)(i) Software that monitors and/or records the actions of targeted users.(ii) A small piece of code that misleads users of its true intent by disguising itself as a legitimate program and infects your computer when you run it.(iii) Software that locks data files and demands a monetary payment in exchange for unlocking.(iv) A piece of code that replicates itself to other devices without user interactionChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iv)
  • D.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)

The correct answer is option (D) - (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii).

 

Ransomware → (iii): This malware locks or encrypts a user’s data and demands ransom to restore access.

 

Spyware → (i): It secretly monitors and gathers user information without their knowledge.

 

Worm → (iv): A self-replicating program that spreads without needing to attach to other programs or user action.

 

Trojan Horses → (ii): Malicious code disguised as a legitimate program that activates when the user runs it.

Question 34
Which of the following are advantages of e-commerce for consumers ?(a) They save time by visiting websites instead of stores.(b) They have little risk of having their credit card number intercepted.(c) They can choose goods from any vendor in the world.(d) They can shop no matter their location, time, or conditions.Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a) and (d) Only
  • B.(b) and (c) Only
  • C.(a), (c) and (d) Only
  • D.(a), (b), (c) and (d)
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (d) Only

The correct answer is: (C) (a), (c) and (d) Only.

 

(a) True — E-commerce saves consumers time as they can shop online instead of physically visiting stores.

 

(b) False — There is still a risk of credit card data interception if security measures are weak.

 

(c) True — Consumers can buy products globally from different vendors.

 

(d) True — E-commerce allows shopping anytime, anywhere, regardless of physical or time constraints.

Question 35
If(L)Mrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then identify the correct ascending order of the following numbers A-D when converted to decimal number system.(a)(102)4(b)(10001)2(c)(103)6(d)(201)3Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(b), (a), (c), (d)
  • B.(a), (c), (d), (b)
  • C.(a), (b), (d), (c)
  • D.(b), (a), (d), (c)
Correct Answer: (b), (a), (d), (c)

(102)4 is equal to 18 in base 10.

(10001)2 is equal to 17 in base 10.

(103)6 is equal to 39 in base 10.

(201)3 is equal to 19 in base 10.

Question 36
What is the mission of International Solar Alliance ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Every home no matter how far will have electricity
  • B.Every home will harvest solar energy
  • C.Every home no matter how far away will have light at home
  • D.Every home has to be carbon neutral
Correct Answer: Every home no matter how far away will have light at home

The correct answer is: (C) Every home no matter how far away will have light at home

 

The mission of the International Solar Alliance (ISA) is to ensure that every home, no matter how far away, has access to clean, affordable, and sustainable light, primarily by promoting the use of solar energy solutions in remote and energy-deficient areas.

Question 37
Amount of destruction caused by an earthquake is measured by :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Richter Scale
  • B.Intensity Scale
  • C.Magnitude Scale
  • D.Mercalli Scale
Correct Answer: Mercalli Scale

The correct answer is: (D) Mercalli Scale

 

The Mercalli Scale measures the intensity of an earthquake, i.e., the amount of destruction caused and how it is felt by people and structures.

Question 38
Which of the following are consequences of Global Warming?(a) Change in Hydrological Cycle(b) Species Migration(c) Change in Ocean Circulation(d) Ocean Acidification(e) Sea level riseChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b) and (C) Only
  • B.(a), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • D.(a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)

The correct answer is: (D) (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)

 

All the listed options are consequences of global warming:

 

(a) Change in Hydrological Cycle – Warmer temperatures increase evaporation and change precipitation patterns.

 

(b) Species Migration – Many species shift habitats due to temperature changes.

 

(c) Change in Ocean Circulation – Melting polar ice and warming oceans affect currents.

 

(d) Ocean Acidification – More CO₂ in the atmosphere dissolves in oceans, increasing acidity.

 

(e) Sea Level Rise – Caused by melting glaciers and thermal expansion of seawater.

Question 39
Which of the following is NOT a disease caused due to exposure of Ultra Violet (UV)-rays, one of the Environmental hazards due to ozone layer depletion?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Melanoma
  • B.Erythema
  • C.Teratoma
  • D.Carcinoma
Correct Answer: Teratoma

The correct answer is: (C) Teratoma

 

Melanoma, Erythema, and Carcinoma are linked to UV exposure due to ozone layer depletion:

 

Melanoma: A serious form of skin cancer caused by UV radiation.

 

Erythema: Skin redness or sunburn due to UV exposure.

 

Carcinoma: Includes various types of skin cancers, also caused by UV rays.

 

Teratoma, on the other hand, is a type of tumor containing tissue from different germ layers and is not caused by UV exposure.

Question 40
Because of Biochemical Oxygen Demand (BOD), Dissolved Oxygen (DO) of a water body:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Increases
  • B.Decreases
  • C.Remains unchanged
  • D.Initially increases and then decreases
Correct Answer: Decreases

The correct answer is: (B) Decreases

 

Biochemical Oxygen Demand (BOD) is the amount of oxygen required by microorganisms to decompose organic matter in water.

 

When BOD is high, it means more organic pollution is present, and microorganisms consume more oxygen to break it down.

 

This leads to a decrease in Dissolved Oxygen (DO), which can harm aquatic life.

Question 41
An IT giant company has its Global Education Centre at:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Medak
  • B.Ratnagiri
  • C.Mysore
  • D.Agartala
Correct Answer: Mysore

The correct answer is: (C) Mysore

 

The Global Education Centre (GEC) of Infosys, one of India's largest IT companies, is located in Mysore, Karnataka. It is one of the world's largest corporate training facilities, where Infosys trains thousands of new employees every year.

Question 42
The Indian Institute of Management, Indore, was set up during :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Eighth five year plan
  • B.Ninth five year plan
  • C.Tenth five year plan
  • D.Eleventh five year plan
Correct Answer: Ninth five year plan

The Indian Institute of Management, Indore, was set up during Ninth Five-Year Plan.

 

The Ninth Five-Year Plan of India (1997–2002) focused on "Growth with Social Justice and Equality".

Question 43
The Union Government of India had in 2011 decided to establish a National Institute of Design in the states of :(a) Andhra Pradesh(b) Kerala(C) Assam(d) Goa(C) HaryanaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(a), (c) and (e) Only
  • D.(d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (e) Only

The Union Government of India had in 2011 decided to establish a National Institute of Design in the states of Andhra Pradesh, Assam, and Haryana.

Question 44
The New Education Policy of 2020, suggested degree courses in :(a) Development Communication(b) Logic(c) Art and Museum Administration(d) Graphic Design(e) Web DesignChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e) Only
  • D.(b), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (c), (d) and (e) Only

The correct answer is (C) (c), (d) and (e) Only.

 

The New Education Policy (NEP) of 2020 suggested offering degree courses in fields such as Art and Museum Administration, Graphic Design, and Web Design to cater to emerging skills and industries. This aligns with the policy's goal of diversifying educational options and enhancing creative and digital skills.

Question 45
Who among the following ancient scholars was a proponent of Grammarian tradition ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Ishwarkrishna
  • B.Bhartrhari
  • C.Gautama
  • D.Kanada
Correct Answer: Bhartrhari

The correct answer is (B) Bhartrhari.

 

Bhartrhari was a prominent ancient Indian philosopher and grammarian, known for his work on the philosophy of language and grammar, particularly through his treatise Vakyapadiya, which is a key text in the grammarian tradition. He is considered one of the leading figures in the Indian grammatical tradition, focusing on the connection between words and meaning.

Question 46
Read the following passage and answer the questions.Folk traditions provide and create a public space where some broader social values could be generated and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing into focus ideas, values and contentions into public discourse, a kind of unshackling of inhibitions in a stress-free manner. The changes that modernity brings in its wake become more socially acceptable and the conflicts that are created find a medium through which they can be resolved. This public space or sphere has many constructive and pleasurable uses. Politics and religion are notable instances in which the creation and sustenance of public space or sphere is very important to achieve some agenda(s). The dynamism ingrained in public space or sphere shows complex nuances and many trends especially when the nature of transformation is being analysed. There seems to be a shift from a simple pleasure orientation to cater to multi-level interests of the performers and patrons. Transformations are influenced by economics, politics and voices of dissent that find various mechanisms of appropriation of public space for their own objectives. They widen the base of debate and discussion transcending the involved units.Role of folklore in the society is :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.To provide entertainment only
  • B.To generate and observe broader social value
  • C.To restrict public discourse
  • D.To resist social change
Correct Answer: To generate and observe broader social value

From the passage:

 

“Folk traditions provide and create a public space where some broader social values could be generated and observed.”

 

This aligns with option (B).

Question 47
Read the following passage and answer the questions.Folk traditions provide and create a public space where some broader social values could be generated and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing into focus ideas, values and contentions into public discourse, a kind of unshackling of inhibitions in a stress-free manner. The changes that modernity brings in its wake become more socially acceptable and the conflicts that are created find a medium through which they can be resolved. This public space or sphere has many constructive and pleasurable uses. Politics and religion are notable instances in which the creation and sustenance of public space or sphere is very important to achieve some agenda(s). The dynamism ingrained in public space or sphere shows complex nuances and many trends especially when the nature of transformation is being analysed. There seems to be a shift from a simple pleasure orientation to cater to multi-level interests of the performers and patrons. Transformations are influenced by economics, politics and voices of dissent that find various mechanisms of appropriation of public space for their own objectives. They widen the base of debate and discussion transcending the involved units.What does folklore contribute to public discourse ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.It creates a public space for stress-free interaction
  • B.It restricts the expression of ideas and values
  • C.It promotes only traditional values
  • D.It eliminates modern influences
Correct Answer: It creates a public space for stress-free interaction

From the passage:

 

“The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing into focus ideas, values and contentions into public discourse, a kind of unshackling of inhibitions in a stress-free manner.”

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 48
Read the following passage and answer the questions.Folk traditions provide and create a public space where some broader social values could be generated and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing into focus ideas, values and contentions into public discourse, a kind of unshackling of inhibitions in a stress-free manner. The changes that modernity brings in its wake become more socially acceptable and the conflicts that are created find a medium through which they can be resolved. This public space or sphere has many constructive and pleasurable uses. Politics and religion are notable instances in which the creation and sustenance of public space or sphere is very important to achieve some agenda(s). The dynamism ingrained in public space or sphere shows complex nuances and many trends especially when the nature of transformation is being analysed. There seems to be a shift from a simple pleasure orientation to cater to multi-level interests of the performers and patrons.   • A.Folk traditions are disappearing.
  • B.It has no effect on ancient tradition.
  • C.It only leads to conflicts without resolution.
  • D.It makes social changes more acceptable.

Question 49
Read the following passage and answer the questions.Folk traditions provide and create a public space where some broader social values could be generated and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing into focus ideas, values and contentions into public discourse, a kind of unshackling of inhibitions in a stress-free manner. The changes that modernity brings in its wake become more socially acceptable and the conflicts that are created find a medium through which they can be resolved. This public space or sphere has many constructive and pleasurable uses. Politics and religion are notable instances in which the creation and sustenance of public space or sphere is very important to achieve some agenda(s). The dynamism ingrained in public space or sphere shows complex nuances and many trends especially when the nature of transformation is being analysed. There seems to be a shift from a simple pleasure orientation to cater to multi-level interests of the performers and patrons. Transformations are influenced by economics, politics and voices of dissent that find various mechanisms of appropriation of public space for their own objectives. They widen the base of debate and discussion transcending the involved units.What influences thetransformationsthat can be observed in public sphere ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)

“Transformations are influenced by economics, politics and voices of dissent...”
