Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the questions.Folk traditions provide and create a public space where some broader social values could be generated and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing and observed. The various folk genres through the creation of public space help in bringing into focus ideas, values and contentions into public discourse, a kind of unshackling of inhibitions in a stress-free manner. The changes that modernity brings in its wake become more socially acceptable and the conflicts that are created find a medium through which they can be resolved. This public space or sphere has many constructive and pleasurable uses. Politics and religion are notable instances in which the creation and sustenance of public space or sphere is very important to achieve some agenda(s). The dynamism ingrained in public space or sphere shows complex nuances and many trends especially when the nature of transformation is being analysed. There seems to be a shift from a simple pleasure orientation to cater to multi-level interests of the performers and patrons. Transformations are influenced by economics, politics and voices of dissent that find various mechanisms of appropriation of public space for their own objectives. They widen the base of debate and discussion transcending the involved units.Public space :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Morning)
  • A.Widens the base of debate and discussion
  • B.Ignores traditional knowledge system
  • C.Insists more on individual growth
  • D.Leads to suppression of human values
Correct Answer: Widens the base of debate and discussion

From the passage:

 

"They widen the base of debate and discussion transcending the involved units."

 

This aligns with option (A).

Quiz Attempt #119705

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following Table-I shows the sales (in Rs. crore) of Ice-cream in India during the six years from 2018 to 2023 and Table-II shows the percentage market share of various companies in the sale of Ice-cream in the near 2020. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow.What is the difference between the sales of Amul and Warna in 2020? (in Rs. Crore)(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.1804
  • B.2380
  • C.1870
  • D.1760
Correct Answer: 1870

Required difference = (28 – 6) % of 8500 = 1870 crore

Question 2
The following Table-I shows the sales (in Rs. crore) of Ice-cream in India during the six years from 2018 to 2023 and Table-II shows the percentage market share of various companies in the sale of Ice-cream in the near 2020. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow.What is the average annual rate of increase in the Ice-Cream sale in 2023 in comparison to the year 2018 ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.5.33 %
  • B.26.67 %
  • C.6.67 %
  • D.10 %
Correct Answer: 5.33 %

Average annual Percentage increase = 15 × 9500-75007500 × 100 = 5.33%

Question 3
The following Table-I shows the sales (in Rs. crore) of Ice-cream in India during the six years from 2018 to 2023 and Table-II shows the percentage market share of various companies in the sale of Ice-cream in the near 2020. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow.If the percentage market share of companies remains the same in 2021 as that in 2020, then what is the increase/decrease in the turnover of Amul from 2020 to 2021?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Rs. 175 crore increase
  • B.Rs. 140 crore decrease
  • C.Rs. 175 crore decrease
  • D.Rs. 140 crore increase
Correct Answer: Rs. 140 crore decrease

Turnover of Amul in 2020 = 28% of 8500 = 2380 crore

Turnover of Amul in 2020 = 28% of 8000 = 2240 crore

Decrease = 2380 – 2240 = 140 crore

Question 4
The following Table-I shows the sales (in Rs. crore) of Ice-cream in India during the six years from 2018 to 2023 and Table-II shows the percentage market share of various companies in the sale of Ice-cream in the near 2020. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow.If the sale of Wadilal increases by 38% from 2020 to 2023, and the percent sale of other companies accordingly stands reduced then what would be the market share of Wadilal in 2023 ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.17.5 %
  • B.18 %
  • C.16.94 %
  • D.16.05 %
Correct Answer: 16.05 %

Sale of Wadilal in 2020 = 13% of 8500 = 1105 crore

Sale in 2023 = 1105 × 1.38 = 1524.9

Share of Wadilal in 2023 = 1524.99500×100 = 16.05%

Question 5
The following Table-I shows the sales (in Rs. crore) of Ice-cream in India during the six years from 2018 to 2023 and Table-II shows the percentage market share of various companies in the sale of Ice-cream in the near 2020. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow.The market share of companies in 2023 is same as in 2020. In 2024, the ice-cream sale increases by 10 % but the market share of Amul falls to 23 %. What is the percentage change in the turnover of Amul from 2023 to 2024 ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.9.64 % increase
  • B.9.64 % decrease
  • C.17.86 % increase
  • D.17.86 % decrease
Correct Answer: 9.64 % decrease

Sales in 2024 = 9500 × 1.1 = 10450

Amul sale in 2023 = 9500 × 0.28 = 2660

Amul sales in 2024 = 10450 × 0.23 = 2403.5

Percentage change share of Amul in 2024 = 2403.5-26602660×100 = -9.64%

Question 6
Arrange the steps of the cycle of self regulated learning in logical order ?(a) Setting goals(b) Regulating learning(c) Enacting Tactics and Strategies(d) Analysing the task(e) Devising plansChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(e), (d), (b), (a), (c)
  • B.(b), (c), (e), (d), (a)
  • C.(d), (a), (e), (c), (b)
  • D.(a), (e), (c), (b), (d)
Correct Answer: (d), (a), (e), (c), (b)

Logical Order of Self-Regulated Learning Cycle is given in option (C), i.e., (d), (a), (e), (c), (b).

 

(d) Analysing the task

➤ Understand what needs to be done.

 

(a) Setting goals

➤ Define specific objectives based on the task.

 

(e) Devising plans

➤ Plan how to achieve those goals.

 

(c) Enacting tactics and strategies

➤ Apply learning methods and strategies.

 

(b) Regulating learning

➤ Monitor and adjust strategies as needed during the process.

Question 7
When the content that we have previously learned interferes with the recall of something newly learned then the interference is :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Retroactive Inhibition
  • B.Proactive Inhibition
  • C.Attention Inhibition
  • D.Response Inhibition
Correct Answer: Proactive Inhibition

Proactive Inhibition (or Proactive Interference) occurs when older memories interfere with the recall of new information.

 

For example: If you’ve learned how to drive a car with manual gear and then try to learn an automatic car, your old habit of using the clutch might interfere — this is proactive interference.

Question 8
Anna sits at her kitchen table and is able to think about what she needs to buy from the grocery stores. She is using her ability to :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Recognise
  • B.Recite
  • C.Recall
  • D.Memorize
Correct Answer: Recall

Recall is the ability to actively retrieve information from memory without cues. In this case, Anna is mentally retrieving her grocery list, using her recall ability.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 9
The contents of Swayamprabha Channel-11 with the theme of 'Social Sciences and Humanities are provided by:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.CEC, New Delhi
  • B.IGNOU, New Delhi
  • C.IIT, Delhi
  • D.IIT, Madras
Correct Answer: IGNOU, New Delhi

The contents of Swayamprabha Channel-11 with the theme of 'Social Sciences and Humanities are provided by IGNOU, New Delhi.

Question 10
In a biology class, a teacher wants to conduct a formative assessment to gauge students understanding of cell structure and function. Which of the following tools would be most effective for creating interactive quizzes with immediate feedback ?(a) Google forms(b) Adobe Illustrator(c) Kahoot(d) Audacity(e) CamtasiaChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(b), (c) and (e) Only
  • B.(a), (c), (d) and (e) Only
  • C.(a) and (c) Only
  • D.(b), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a) and (c) Only

The goal is to create interactive quizzes with immediate feedback. Following tools will be helpful:

 

(a) Google Forms – Allows quiz creation with multiple-choice, short answers, automatic grading, and instant feedback.

 

(c) Kahoot – Game-based learning platform ideal for interactive quizzes with real-time feedback and engagement.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 11
Which of the following represents the epistemological orientation of qualitative research ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Deductivism
  • B.Positivism
  • C.Objectivism
  • D.Interpretivism
Correct Answer: Interpretivism

The epistemological orientation of qualitative research is typically interpretivism. Interpretivism emphasizes understanding the meaning and experiences of individuals from their own perspectives, rather than relying on objective measurements or generalizations.

Deductivism (A) and Positivism (B) are more closely related to quantitative research, which focuses on testing hypotheses and objective observation.

Objectivism (C) assumes an objective reality that can be measured, which is not aligned with the subjective nature of qualitative research.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Interpretivism.

Question 12
In many studies that span a long period of time, participants in the study may leave. This constitutes which of the following threats to internal validity ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Testing
  • B.Instrumentation
  • C.Mortality
  • D.Maturation
Correct Answer: Mortality

When participants leave a study over time, it is referred to as mortality, which is a threat to internal validity. Mortality occurs when participants drop out or are lost to follow-up, potentially affecting the results and generalizability of the study.

Testing (A) refers to changes in participants' responses due to repeated testing.

Instrumentation (B) involves changes in measurement tools or procedures over time.

Maturation (D) refers to changes in participants that occur naturally over time, unrelated to the study.

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Mortality.

Question 13
Identify the correct order of the following information about a research article, according to the APA style of writing journal article references.(a) Volume number(b) Year of publication(c) DOI(d) Title of article(e) Name of journalChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(c), (d), (b), (a), (e)
  • B.(b), (d), (e), (a), (c)
  • C.(d), (e), (a), (b), (c)
  • D.(d), (e), (c), (a), (b)
Correct Answer: (b), (d), (e), (a), (c)

According to the APA style for referencing journal articles, the correct order of the information is as follows:

Year of publication (b)

Title of article (d)

Name of journal (e)

Volume number (a)

DOI (c)

Thus, the correct answer is (B) (b), (d), (e), (a), (c).

Question 14
Identify the continuous variables.(a) Number of tails obtained in hundred tosses of a coin(b) Weight of students in a school(c) Marks scored by students in an objective type examination(d) Height of plants in an agricultural fieldChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(c) and (d) Only
  • C.(a) and (c) Only
  • D.(b) and (d) Only
Correct Answer: (b) and (d) Only

Continuous variables can take any value within a given range and are measured rather than counted.

(a) Number of tails obtained in hundred tosses of a coin is a discrete variable because it involves counting a specific outcome.

(b) Weight of students in a school is a continuous variable, as weight can take any value within a range and is measured.

(c) Marks scored by students in an objective type examination is typically considered discrete, as it involves counting marks based on specific options or score increments.

(d) Height of plants in an agricultural field is a continuous variable because height can take any value within a given range.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) (b) and (d) Only.

Question 15
Identify the non-parametric tests used in statistical analysis.(a) F- test(b) U-test(c) H-test(d) t-testChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(b) and (c) Only
  • C.(c) and (d) Only
  • D.(a) and (d) Only
Correct Answer: (b) and (c) Only

Non-parametric tests are statistical tests that do not assume a specific distribution for the data and are often used when data does not meet the assumptions required for parametric tests. Let's evaluate each option:

F-test (a): This is a parametric test used to compare variances between groups and assumes the data follows a normal distribution.

U-test (b): This is a non-parametric test (also known as the Mann-Whitney U test), used to compare two independent groups when the assumptions of the t-test are not met.

H-test (c): This is a non-parametric test (also known as the Kruskal-Wallis test), used to compare more than two independent groups when the assumptions of ANOVA are not met.

t-test (d): This is a parametric test used to compare the means of two groups, assuming the data follows a normal distribution.

 

Therefore, the non-parametric tests in the list are (b) U-test and (c) H-test.

Question 16
A cartoon is of:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.High definition
  • B.Low definition
  • C.Neutral definition
  • D.Negative definition
Correct Answer: Low definition

In media theory, especially as described by Marshall McLuhan, a "low definition" medium is one that provides less detailed information and requires more viewer participation to interpret and engage.

 

A cartoon, being simplified, symbolic, and abstract, fits this description. It offers minimal detail, leaving much to the viewer’s imagination.

 

Thus, option (B) is correct.

Question 17
The period of time when a communication network becomes inoperative, is referred to as:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Time fit
  • B.Uptime
  • C.Downtime
  • D.Loadtime
Correct Answer: Downtime

Downtime refers to the period when a communication network, server, or system is not operational or unavailable.

 

It can be due to maintenance, failures, or unexpected disruptions.

Question 18
Which of the following concepts are related to mass communication ?(a) Global village(b) Medium is the message(c) The extension of man(d) Pop culture prophetChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (d) Only
  • B.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • C.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • D.(a) and (b)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c) Only

The concept that are related to mass communication are as follows:

(a) Global Village –

Coined by Marshall McLuhan, it refers to the way mass media (especially electronic media) connects people globally, making the world feel like a small community.

 

(b) Medium is the Message –

Also from McLuhan, this phrase means that the form of media (the medium) influences how the message is perceived, often more than the content itself.

 

(c) The Extension of Man –

Refers to McLuhan’s idea that media and technology extend human senses and capabilities, forming a central idea in his mass communication theory.

 

(d) Pop Culture Prophet –

It is not a formal concept related to mass communication theory.

 

Thus, option (B) is correct.

Question 19
Only As a mode of communication, drama has four forms from the western perspective. They are :(a) Tragedy(b) Comedy(c) Serious drama(d) Melodrama(e) Character dramaChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (b), (c), (d) Only
  • B.(b), (c), (e) Only
  • C.(a), (c), (d), (e) Only
  • D.(a), (b), (d), (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c), (d) Only

From the Western perspective, drama is traditionally classified into the following four primary forms:

 

(a) Tragedy –

Deals with serious themes and often ends in the downfall of the main character.

 

(b) Comedy –

Light-hearted in tone, aiming to amuse and often ending happily.

 

(c) Serious Drama –

Also known as drama in a general sense; includes realistic characters and emotional themes, without the extreme tone of tragedy or comedy.

 

(d) Melodrama –

Characterized by exaggerated plot and emotions, often with clear distinctions between good and evil.

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 20
Identify the correct chronological sequence of the following :(a) Launch of Twitter(b) Launch of Facebook(c) Appearance of social network sites(d) Launch of Sputnik(e) 'War of the worlds' broadcastChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (c), (b), (e), (d)
  • B.(e), (d), (c), (b), (a)
  • C.(b), (e), (d), (a), (c)
  • D.(c), (b), (a), (d), (e)
Correct Answer: (e), (d), (c), (b), (a)

Following is the chronological order with Years:

(e) 'War of the Worlds' broadcast – 1938

 

A famous radio drama by Orson Welles that caused panic as listeners thought it was real.

 

(d) Launch of Sputnik – 1957

 

The first artificial Earth satellite launched by the Soviet Union.

 

(c) Appearance of social network sites – Early 2000s

 

Social networking sites like Friendster (2002) and MySpace (2003) predated Facebook.

 

(b) Launch of Facebook – 2004

 

Started by Mark Zuckerberg at Harvard.

 

(a) Launch of Twitter – 2006

 

A microblogging platform launched publicly in July 2006.

 

Thus, option (B) is correct.

Question 21
Three successive discounts of 15 %, 20 % and 40 % on the marked price of an item are equivalent to a single discount of :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.75%
  • B.40.8 %
  • C.59.2 %
  • D.67.5 %
Correct Answer: 59.2 %

Let Price be 100 Rs.

After three successive discounts, price = 100 × 0.85 × 0.8 × 0.6 = 40.8

So Discount = 100 – 40.8 = 59.2%

Question 22
15 men working 8 hours per day complete a piece of work in 18 days. To complete the same work in 6 days, working 12 hours a day, the number of men required will be :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.24 men
  • B.26 men
  • C.28 men
  • D.30 men
Correct Answer: 30 men

Let x be the men required.

15 × 8 × 18 = x × 12 × 6

or


Question 23
Find the next term in the series…..2Z5, 7Y7, 14X9, 23W11, 34V13, (?)(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.27U24
  • B.45U15
  • C.47U15
  • D.47U14
Correct Answer: 47U15

The sum of first and last number of each term is the first number.

The middle letter is decreasing by 1

The last number is increasing by 2

Thus, next term will be 47U15

Question 24
In a certain coding language, if the word 'TREND' is coded as 'QUBQA', then the word 'STRAY' will be coded as.(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.PVPDV
  • B.PWPDW
  • C.PWODV
  • D.QWPEW
Correct Answer: PWODV

Similarly

Question 25
A person travels from X to Y at a speed of 30 km/hr and returns from Y to X by increasing his speed by 50%. His average speed during the journey is :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.37.5 km/hr
  • B.37 km/hr
  • C.36 km/hr
  • D.38 km/hr
Correct Answer: 36 km/hr

Speed while returning be 45 km/hr

 

Let D be the distance and x be the average speed

Then, D30 + D45 = 2Dx

or x = 36

Question 26
Identify the fallacy committed in the statement given below :"People who lack arrogance are intelligent because intelligent people do not have arrogance"(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Equivocation
  • B.Fallacy of division
  • C.Begging the question
  • D.Fallacy of composition
Correct Answer: Begging the question

The fallacy committed in the statement "People who lack arrogance are intelligent because intelligent people do not have arrogance" is begging the question (C).

 

This fallacy occurs when the argument's premise assumes the truth of the conclusion. In this case, the statement is essentially saying that intelligent people do not have arrogance, and therefore, people without arrogance must be intelligent, which assumes the point it is trying to prove (that lack of arrogance equals intelligence).

Equivocation (A) would involve using a word in different senses within the argument, but the word "arrogance" is not being used ambiguously here.

Fallacy of division (B) occurs when it is assumed that what is true for the whole is true for the parts, but that's not what is happening in this argument.

Fallacy of composition (D) involves assuming what is true for the parts is true for the whole, but this isn't relevant to the structure of this argument either.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Begging the question.

Question 27
Which of the following propositions is contrary to the proposition. "All cows are herbivores" ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.All herbivores are cows.
  • B.Some cows are herbivores.
  • C.Some cows are not herbivores.
  • D.No cows are herbivores.
Correct Answer: No cows are herbivores.

In the Classical Square of Opposition, contrary propositions are those that cannot both be true, but they can both be false.

 

The proposition "All cows are herbivores" is an A-type proposition (Universal Affirmative), which means every cow is a herbivore.

 

A contrary to an A-type proposition (All S are P) is an E-type proposition (Universal Negative), which denies the relationship entirely. So, the contrary of "All cows are herbivores" would be "No cows are herbivores".

Question 28
Which of the following statements are logically equivalent ?(a) All cows are herbivores.(b) All herbivores are cows.(c) Some herbivores are cows.(d) No cows are non-herbivores.Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(b) and (d) Only
  • C.(b) and (c) Only
  • D.(a) and (d) Only
Correct Answer: (a) and (d) Only

No cows are non-herbivores is OBVERSION of All cows are herbivores.

Question 29
Which of the following propositions cannot both be false, though they can both be true ?(a) All cows are herbivores.(b) No cows are herbivores.(c) Some cows are herbivores.(d) Some cows are not herbivores.Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a) and (d) Only
  • B.(c) and (d) Only
  • C.(b) and (c) Only
  • D.(a) and (c) Only
Correct Answer: (c) and (d) Only

According to the definition of subcontraries, two propositions are subcontraries if they cannot both be false, although they can both be true. This applies to particular propositions (I and O) that have the same subject and predicate but differ in quality (one is affirmative, the other is negative).

I-type proposition (affirmative): "Some cows are herbivores"

O-type proposition (negative): "Some cows are not herbivores"

Question 30
According to classical Indian Philosophy the source of knowledge based on cognition of an object, similar to another one which is already known to the cognizer is known as :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Sabda
  • B.Pratyaksa
  • C.Anumana
  • D.Upamana’
Correct Answer: Upamana’

It is a third type of valid cognition, Upamiti, which utilizes Upamana as its means. Breaking down the term, "Upa" signifies near or close, implying a familiarity or knowledge, while "Mana" denotes understanding. Thus, Upamana refers to knowledge gained by comparing it to a known object. It's a form of cognition derived from comparison, akin to analogy, and often involves understanding the relationship between a word and what it denotes, based on resemblance or similarity.

Question 31
Which of the following electronic technologies is the key technology for making the fourth- generation electronic computer?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Transistor based
  • B.Integrated Circuit (IC) based
  • C.Vacuum Tube based
  • D.Microprocessor based
Correct Answer: Microprocessor based

The correct answer is: (D) Microprocessor based

 

Fourth-generation electronic computers are defined by the use of microprocessors, which integrate the functions of a computer's central processing unit (CPU) onto a single integrated circuit (chip). This technology emerged in the 1970s, enabling faster processing, greater reliability, and reduced size and cost compared to earlier generations that used transistors or ICs alone.

Question 32
Many websites require the following to be completed:I'm not a robot.This is an example of which data issue?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Accuracy
  • B.Matching
  • C.Quality
  • D.Security
Correct Answer: Security

The correct answer is: (D) Security.

 

The prompt “I’m not a robot” is part of a CAPTCHA system used to prevent automated bots from abusing online forms or services. This is a security measure designed to ensure that the user is a human and not a script or malicious program, thereby protecting the website from spam, fraud, or cyberattacks.

Question 33
Identify the sequence of words A-E that correctly fills the blanks in the following paragraph : _____ is small amount of memory located on the CPU itself._____ is a form of ROM that is commonly used in embedded devices such as washing machines, smart phones, etc. _____ is mainly used in a PC to store the tiny OS called the BIOS. _____ is a storage allocation scheme in which secondary memory can be addressed as though it were part of the main memory. _____ is a type of very fast memory that is used to temporarily hold data about currently running programs.(a) ROM(b) RAM(c) Cache memory(d) Flash memory(e) Virtual memoryChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(d), (c), (a), (e), (b)
  • B.(c), (d), (a), (e), (b)
  • C.(c), (d), (b), (e), (a)
  • D.(b), (d), (a), (c), (e)
Correct Answer: (c), (d), (a), (e), (b)

The correct answer is: (B) (c), (d), (a), (e), (b)

 

Let's match each blank with the appropriate term:

 

Cache memory is a small amount of high-speed memory located on the CPU itself – used to store frequently accessed data.

 

Flash memory is a type of non-volatile ROM used in embedded devices like smartphones, washing machines, etc.

 

ROM stores firmware like the BIOS in PCs – it’s non-volatile memory.

 

Virtual memory is a memory management technique where secondary storage (like a hard disk) is used as an extension of RAM.

 

RAM is the main memory used to store data and instructions for currently running programs.

 

So, the correct sequence is: (c), (d), (a), (e), (b) → Option B.

Question 34
If(L)Mrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then which of the following numbers are equivalent to(19)16?(a)(11001)2(b)(201)3(c)(121)4(d)(101)5(e)(25)10Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (c) and (e) Only
  • B.(b) and (d) Only
  • C.(a), (b) and (d) Only
  • D.(a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (e) Only

(19)16 is equal to 11001 in base 2.

(19)16 is equal to 221 in base 3.

(19)16 is equal to 121 in base 4.

(19)16 is equal to 100 in base 5.

(19)16 is equal to 25 in base 10.

Question 35
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Computer Terms)(a) Motherboard(b) BIOS(c) CMOS(d) HTTPList - II (Purpose)(i) Stores the date, time and system configuration for BIOS(ii) Allows processor and other hardware to function and communicate with each other(iii) Transfer the contents of web pages into a web browser for viewing(iv) Initializes and tests the system hardware components and loads an OS when a computer is turned onChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)

The correct answer is: (C) (a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)

 

Motherboard → (ii)

It is the main circuit board that allows the processor and other hardware components to function and communicate with each other.

 

BIOS → (iv)

The Basic Input/Output System initializes and tests hardware components and loads the operating system when the computer starts.

 

CMOS → (i)

The Complementary Metal-Oxide Semiconductor stores settings like date, time, and hardware configuration needed by the BIOS.

 

HTTP → (iii)

The HyperText Transfer Protocol is used for transferring web page content to your browser.

Question 36
In Kyoto protocol, how much target was fixed for the reduction of concentration of Green House Gases (GHGs) below 1990 level, during first commitment period 2008-12 by state parties ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.1.0 %
  • B.5.2 %
  • C.10.4 %
  • D.20.0 %
Correct Answer: 5.2 %

Option B is the correct answer.

Question 37
Which of the following are biogas ?(a) Marsh Gas(b) Swamp Gas(c) Producer Gas(d) Compost Gas(e) Flue GasChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (b) and (d) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (e) Only
  • C.(a), (c) and (e) Only
  • D.(c), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (d) Only

The correct answer is: (A) (a), (b) and (d) Only

 

Biogas refers to gases produced by the breakdown of organic matter in the absence of oxygen (anaerobic digestion). It primarily contains methane (CH₄) and carbon dioxide (CO₂).

 

(a) Marsh Gas – Another name for methane, produced in marshy areas by microbial activity — biogas.

 

(b) Swamp Gas – Also largely methane produced from decaying plant matter in swamps — biogas.

 

(d) Compost Gas – Formed during decomposition of organic compost material — also biogas.

 

(c) Producer Gas – Formed by gasification of coal or biomass with air, contains CO and H₂ — not biogas.

 

(e) Flue Gas – Emitted from combustion of fuel in furnaces or engines; contains CO₂, SO₂, NOₓ — not biogas.

Question 38
Which one of the following is considered to be the finest Particulate Matter?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Fine mode particles
  • B.Neudeation mode particles
  • C.Aitken mode particles
  • D.Accumulation mode particles
Correct Answer: Neudeation mode particles

Option B is the correct answer.

Question 39
Which one of the following is an example of natural climate forcing?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Green House Gases
  • B.Volcanic eruptions
  • C.Land use changes
  • D.Tropospheric aerosols
Correct Answer: Volcanic eruptions

The correct answer is: (B) Volcanic eruptions.

 

Volcanic eruptions are a natural climate forcing mechanism. They inject sulphate aerosols into the atmosphere, which reflect sunlight and can lead to temporary cooling of the Earth’s surface.

Question 40
Which of the following are true about Pyrolysis?(a) It produces less air pollution than complete incineration.(b) It is done in the presence of oxygen.(c) Instead of oxidation a complex series of decomposition and other chemical reactions take place.(d) Pyrolysis many times generates useful materials.(e) Pyrolysis is a high temperature thermal process, an alternative to incineration.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (b), (c) and (d) Only
  • B.(a), (c), (d) and (e) Only
  • C.(b), (c), (d) and (e) Only
  • D.(a), (b) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (c), (d) and (e) Only

The correct answer is: (B) (a), (c), (d) and (e) Only

 

(a) It produces less air pollution than complete incineration: Pyrolysis produces less air pollution compared to incineration because it involves the absence or limited presence of oxygen, reducing harmful emissions like carbon dioxide and dioxins.

 

(b) It is done in the presence of oxygen: This is incorrect. Pyrolysis is done in the absence or limited presence of oxygen, unlike incineration, which requires oxygen for combustion.

 

(c) Instead of oxidation, a complex series of decomposition and other chemical reactions take place: Correct. Pyrolysis involves decomposition reactions where organic materials break down into smaller molecules in the absence of oxygen.

 

(d) Pyrolysis many times generates useful materials: Correct. It can produce useful by-products like biochar, oils, and gases that can be used as energy sources.

 

(e) Pyrolysis is a high-temperature thermal process, an alternative to incineration: Correct. Pyrolysis is indeed a high-temperature process used as an alternative to incineration but under different conditions (low or no oxygen).

Question 41
The first foreign university to set up its campus at GIFT City, Gujarat, is :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.London University, Britain
  • B.Queen's University, Ireland
  • C.Deak in University, Australia
  • D.Moscow University, Russia
Correct Answer: Deak in University, Australia

The correct answer is: (C) Deakin University, Australia

 

Deakin University, an Australian institution, established its campus in Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT City), making it the first foreign university to set up a teaching campus in India.

Question 42
The National Education Policy 2020 recommended moving towards:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Suburban Universities
  • B.Single discipline Universities
  • C.Multi-disciplinary Universities
  • D.Specialised Universities
Correct Answer: Multi-disciplinary Universities

The correct answer is: (C) Multi-disciplinary Universities

 

The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 emphasizes the importance of creating multi-disciplinary universities and institutions, which offer a range of courses across disciplines. This approach is designed to encourage holistic learning, foster creativity, and allow students to explore various subjects rather than limiting them to a single area of study. The NEP envisions a shift away from siloed, discipline-specific institutions and advocates for institutions that encourage the blending of different fields of knowledge.

 

This aligns with the policy's broader goal of broadening the scope of higher education and making it more inclusive and adaptable to the needs of the 21st century.

Question 43
Identify the public sector universities from the following that have the highest number of collaboration with foreign universities.(a) Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur(b) Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru(c) Pondicherry University, Pondicherry(d) North-Eastern Hill University, Shillong(e) Gujarat Vidyapeeth, GujaratChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (b), (c) Only
  • B.(b), (c), (d) Only
  • C.(c), (d), (e) Only
  • D.(a), (d), (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c) Only

Option A is the correct answer.

Question 44
Which of the following come under the category of Stand-Alone Professional Universities?(a) Universities of Journalism(b) Law Universities(c) Health Science Universities(d) Technical Universities(e) Homeopathy UniversitiesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a), (b), (c) Only
  • B.(a), (b), (d) Only
  • C.(c), (d), (e) Only
  • D.(b), (c), (d) Only
Correct Answer: (b), (c), (d) Only

Stand-Alone Professional Universities are institutions focused on a single field or discipline.

 

Here, (b), (c), (d) comes under the category of Stand-Alone Professional Universities.

Question 45
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Commission/Committee)(a)UniversityEducation Commission (1948-49)(b)SanskritCommission(c) Education Commission (1964-66)(d) Committee on Higher Education for Rural Areas (1954)List - II (Chairperson)(i) D. S. Kothari(ii) K. L. Shirmali(iii) S. Radhakrishna(iv) Suniti Kumar ChatterjiChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)

The correct answer is: (C) (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)

 

University Education Commission (1948-49) was chaired by S. Radhakrishnan (Option iii). This commission was pivotal in shaping the development of higher education in India after independence.

 

Sanskrit Commission was chaired by Suniti Kumar Chatterji (Option iv). It focused on promoting Sanskrit education in India.

 

Education Commission (1964-66), also known as the Kothari Commission, was chaired by D. S. Kothari (Option i). It made significant contributions to the development of education in India and laid the foundation for the National Policy on Education.

 

Committee on Higher Education for Rural Areas (1954) was chaired by K. L. Shirmali (Option ii). This committee emphasized the need for improving higher education in rural areas.

Question 46
Read the following passage and answer the questions given below :Santiniketan attempted to produce a culture, which was Bengali/Indian in its construction and approach yet significant to the modern world. In 191Z Rabindranath established an institution called Ashram-Sammilani. It was a body of elected students with teachers in-charge to look after the functioning of the school. Students' Unions are primarily concerned with student interest; they-or any other union, for that matter-are formed to protect their rights against the authority's misuse of power. There was a court run by the elected student body. Whenever there was a complaint of any serious offence, the court had its session with the accused in some quiet place after dinner. The Sammilani met twice a month-once on new-moon nights, the other on full-moon nights. During Rabindranath's long stay at Silaidaha among the villagers he realised that only self-sufficiency, self-rule and self-respect could free our rural population from their weakness, poverty and sense of inferiority; that it was society that should rule, not the state imported from Europe. Sriniketan-Visva-Bharati's rural development/reconstruction programme started in 1922. Rabindranath applied the principles of the co-operative movement to Sriniketan; and as we know he applied it everywhere-equal respect for everybody, equal participation, equal distribution of material and spiritual wealth.Main aim of Santiniketan can be stated as :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.To spread the culture of Kolkata
  • B.To completely ignore the western influences
  • C.To emphasize on a culture that was Bengali/Indian yet significant to the modern world
  • D.To focus only on the traditional folk culture
Correct Answer: To emphasize on a culture that was Bengali/Indian yet significant to the modern world

The very first line of the passage states:

 

“Santiniketan attempted to produce a culture, which was Bengali/Indian in its construction and approach yet significant to the modern world.”

 

This directly aligns with option (C).

Question 47
Read the following passage and answer the questions given below :Santiniketan attempted to produce a culture, which was Bengali/Indian in its construction and approach yet significant to the modern world. In 191Z Rabindranath established an institution called Ashram-Sammilani. It was a body of elected students with teachers in-charge to look after the functioning of the school. Students' Unions are primarily concerned with student interest; they-or any other union, for that matter-are formed to protect their rights against the authority's misuse of power. There was a court run by the elected student body. Whenever there was a complaint of any serious offence, the court had its session with the accused in some quiet place after dinner. The Sammilani met twice a month-once on new-moon nights, the other on full-moon nights. During Rabindranath's long stay at Silaidaha among the villagers he realised that only self-sufficiency, self-rule and self-respect could free our rural population from their weakness, poverty and sense of inferiority; that it was society that should rule, not the state imported from Europe. Sriniketan-Visva-Bharati's rural development/reconstruction programme started in 1922. Rabindranath applied the principles of the co-operative movement to Sriniketan; and as we know he applied it everywhere-equal respect for everybody, equal participation, equal distribution of material and spiritual wealth.Aim of Ashram-Sammilani was :(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.To function as a typical student union
  • B.To talk about the student's rights
  • C.To look after the functioning of the school with a body of elected students and teachers in-charge
  • D.To manage the financial situation of the institution
Correct Answer: To look after the functioning of the school with a body of elected students and teachers in-charge

From the passage:

 

“Rabindranath established an institution called Ashram-Sammilani. It was a body of elected students with teachers in-charge to look after the functioning of the school.”

 

This directly matches option (C).

Question 48
Read the following passage and answer the questions given below :Santiniketan attempted to produce a culture, which was Bengali/Indian in its construction and approach yet significant to the modern world. In 191Z Rabindranath established an institution called Ashram-Sammilani. It was a body of elected students with teachers in-charge to look after the functioning of the school. Students' Unions are primarily concerned with student interest; they-or any other union, for that matter-are formed to protect their rights against the authority's misuse of power. There was a court run by the elected student body. Whenever there was a complaint of any serious offence, the court had its session with the accused in some quiet place after dinner. The Sammilani met twice a month-once on new-moon nights, the other on full-moon nights. During Rabindranath's long stay at Silaidaha among the villagers he realised that only self-sufficiency, self-rule and self-respect could free our rural population from their weakness, poverty and sense of inferiority; that it was society that should rule, not the state imported from Europe. Sriniketan-Visva-Bharati's rural development/reconstruction programme started in 1922. Rabindranath applied the principles of the co-operative movement to Sriniketan; and as we know he applied it everywhere-equal respect for everybody, equal participation, equal distribution of material and spiritual wealth.How often did the Ashram-Sammilani meet ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Once a year
  • B.Twice a month
  • C.Weekly
  • D.Monthly
Correct Answer: Twice a month

From the passage:

 

“The Sammilani met twice a month—once on new-moon nights, the other on full-moon nights.”

 

This aligns with option (B).

Question 49
Read the following passage and answer the questions given below :Santiniketan attempted to produce a culture, which was Bengali/Indian in its construction and approach yet significant to the modern world. In 191Z Rabindranath established an institution called Ashram-Sammilani. It was a body of elected students with teachers in-charge to look after the functioning of the school. Students' Unions are primarily concerned with student interest; they-or any other union, for that matter-are formed to protect their rights against the authority's misuse of power. There was a court run by the elected student body. Whenever there was a complaint of any serious offence, the court had its session with the accused in some quiet place after dinner. The Sammilani met twice a month-once on new-moon nights, the other on full-moon nights. During Rabindranath's long stay at Silaidaha among the villagers he realised that only self-sufficiency, self-rule and self-respect could free our rural population from their weakness, poverty and sense of inferiority; that it was society that should rule, not the state imported from Europe. Sriniketan-Visva-Bharati's rural development/reconstruction programme started in 1922. Rabindranath applied the principles of the co-operative movement to Sriniketan; and as we know he applied it everywhere-equal respect for everybody, equal participation, equal distribution of material and spiritual wealth.What did Rabindranath Tagore realize while he stayed in Silaidaha ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Only education can uplift the society.
  • B.Society should rule, not the state imported from Europe.
  • C.Industrialization is the major key to prosperity.
  • D.Traditional model of governance is the best approach.
Correct Answer: Society should rule, not the state imported from Europe.

From the passage:

 

“During Rabindranath's long stay at Silaidaha among the villagers he realised that only self-sufficiency, self-rule and self-respect could free our rural population... that it was society that should rule, not the state imported from Europe.”

 

This clearly matches option (B).

Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the questions given below :Santiniketan attempted to produce a culture, which was Bengali/Indian in its construction and approach yet significant to the modern world. In 191Z Rabindranath established an institution called Ashram-Sammilani. It was a body of elected students with teachers in-charge to look after the functioning of the school. Students' Unions are primarily concerned with student interest; they-or any other union, for that matter-are formed to protect their rights against the authority's misuse of power. There was a court run by the elected student body. Whenever there was a complaint of any serious offence, the court had its session with the accused in some quiet place after dinner. The Sammilani met twice a month-once on new-moon nights, the other on full-moon nights. During Rabindranath's long stay at Silaidaha among the villagers he realised that only self-sufficiency, self-rule and self-respect could free our rural population from their weakness, poverty and sense of inferiority; that it was society that should rule, not the state imported from Europe. Sriniketan-Visva-Bharati's rural development/reconstruction programme started in 1922. Rabindranath applied the principles of the co-operative movement to Sriniketan; and as we know he applied it everywhere-equal respect for everybody, equal participation, equal distribution of material and spiritual wealth.What principles did Rabindranath Tagore apply to Sriniketan's rural development program ?(UGC NET 04 Sep 2024 Evening)
  • A.Centralized governance
  • B.Industrial growth
  • C.Equal respect, participation and distribution of wealth
  • D.Personal growth over community welfare
Correct Answer: Equal respect, participation and distribution of wealth

The passage clearly states:

 

“Rabindranath applied the principles of the co-operative movement to Sriniketan; and as we know he applied it everywhere—equal respect for everybody, equal participation, equal distribution of material and spiritual wealth.”

 

This directly aligns with option (C).

Quiz Attempts 741-750 of 849
